      • initializeLogic

        public static void initializeLogic()
        Initializes various variables and populate the employees ids' ArrayList.

      • createOrder

        public static void createOrder()
        Creates order by initializing the OrderEntity with a new OrderEntity.

      • getOrderContent

        public static java.lang.String getOrderContent()
        Retrieves the current order as a specially formatted String
        Returns:
        an OrderEntity

      • addItem

        public static InventoryEntity.ItemStatus addItem(java.lang.String item)
        Adds an item and returns true if the item was added. For an item to be added. The item needs to be either 1) an item which does not contain Alcohol 2) an item contains alcohol but is authorized to be added (requires employee ID).
        Parameters:
        item - the ItemEntity element being added to the Order
        Returns:
        whether an item was added

      • getSubTotal

        public static java.lang.Double getSubTotal()
        Returns the subtotal of the current order. Subtotal = Total - (Subtotal * Tax applied).
        Returns:
        the subtotal, using the calculation above.

      • getOrderTotal

        public static java.lang.Double getOrderTotal()
        Returns the total of the current order. Total = Subtotal + (Subtotal * Tax applied).
        Returns:
        the total, using the calculation above.

      • payByCash

        public static java.lang.Boolean payByCash(java.lang.Double amount)
        Returns whether the cash payment was received. Checks to see whether the amount is equal or greater than or equals to the amount to be made.
        Parameters:
        amount - cash inserted by the client.
        Returns:
        true if the payment was received.

      • payByCredit

        public static java.lang.Boolean payByCredit(java.lang.Integer cardNum)
        Returns whether the credit card payment was received.

        Sends the card number to the bank interface for authorization. Sets the paidByCard variable to true if the payment was authorized and retrieves the last four digits for the receipt.

        Parameters:
        cardNum - card number of the user's credit card.
        Returns:
        true if the payment was received.

      • payByDebit

        public static java.lang.Boolean payByDebit(java.lang.Integer cardNum,
                                           java.lang.Integer pin)
        Returns whether the debit card payment was received.

        Sends the card number to the bank interface for authorization. Sets the paidByCard variable to true if the payment was authorized and retrieves the last four digits for the receipt.

        Parameters:
        cardNum - the debit card number of the client.
        pin - the pin number of the debit card of the client.
        Returns:
        true if the payment was received.

      • flushOrder

        public static void flushOrder()
        Resets the order variable whenever the current order. is cancelled. Allows reuse.

      • processOrder

        public static java.lang.String processOrder()
        Finalize the order and sends back the receipt.

        processOrder decreases the quantity of each items in the inventory by 1. Then the receipt gets printed using the receipt StringBuilder private field. Checks whether the payment was made using a card to include the last four digits on the receipt. Then, the transaction log is updated and it is also sent the order's total. Finally, all the variables are reset.

        Returns:
        the receipt of the order.

      • verifyEmployeeID

        public static java.lang.Boolean verifyEmployeeID(java.lang.String ein)
        Checks to see whether the entered employee ID is valid.
        Parameters:
        ein - the entered employee ID.
        Returns:
        true if the employee ID is valid.
